Administrative Officer Job at Global Peace Development




        
    

        
        Global Peace Development (GPD) is a Non-Governmental Organization (NGO) founded in April 2002 and focuses on promoting peace for development in Nigeria. The organization envisions a country where peace and development is enjoyed by all. GPD seek to build peace, gender equality, social justice, and foster democracy and governance at the community, local, state, and national levels.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Officer

Job Location: Calabar, Cross River
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Summary
     

            
    




	The Administrative Officer plays a crucial role in ensuring the smooth and efficient day-to-day operations of the office.
	This position is responsible for managing general administrative duties, supporting internal coordination, and maintaining an organized, safe, and functional work environment.
	The role bearer will also be responsible for managing and safeguarding the office safe, including proper documentation and controlled access to its contents.


Major Rowles and Responsibilities


	Prepare and disseminate reports of the Organization’s staff weekly meetings
	Support the Procurement of office and project supplies
	Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
	Preparing travel arrangements for the Staff and the management team
	Track staff attendance and movement through registers
	Coordinate logistics arrangements for meetings
	Manage office phone lines and record internal and external correspondence
	Support the Partnership and Business Development Manager on Proposal Development


Required Qualifications and Experience


	B.Sc / HND in Business Administration, Office Technology and management or related field of studies.
	At least 3 - 5 years of work experience, of which must be professional in administrative roles
	Proven ability to provide a high level of support to the management team.


Core Competence:


	Organizational and Planning Skills
	Communication and Interpersonal Skills
	Confidentiality and Integrity
	Computer Literacy and Office Tools Proficiency
	Time Management and Multitasking
	Teamwork and Collaboration
	Logistics and Travel Coordination Skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their cover letter and detailed CV to: Procurement@globalpeacedev.org using "Administrative Officer – Calabar, Cross River State" as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

	Minimum academic qualification of BSc in Accounting, Finance, or relevant degree.

	Excellent knowledge of accounting regulations and procedures
	Hands-on experience with accounting software like FreshBooks and QuickBooks
	Advanced Microsoft Excel skills including Vlookups and pivot tables
	Experience with general ledger functions
	Strong attention to detail and good analytical skills.


Method of Application

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Import / Export and Inbound Logistics Lead",
  "description": "Bisedge provides advanced solutions in the material handling space, in close collaboration with Linde Material Handling, transforming how goods and materials are moved across Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Import / Export and Inbound Logistics Lead

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Import/Export and Inbound Logistics Lead will be responsible for overseeing and managing the international shipping and receiving operations, ensuring compliance with all customs regulations, and optimizing the movement of goods across borders.
	This role will work closely with suppliers, customers, logistics providers, banks, and government agencies to ensure timely, cost-effective, and legally compliant import/export activities.


Responsibilities

Import / Export and Inbound Logistics Lead Job at Bisedge




        
    

        
        Bisedge provides advanced solutions in the material handling space, in close collaboration with Linde Material Handling, transforming how goods and materials are moved across Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Import / Export and Inbound Logistics Lead

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Import/Export and Inbound Logistics Lead will be responsible for overseeing and managing the international shipping and receiving operations, ensuring compliance with all customs regulations, and optimizing the movement of goods across borders.
	This role will work closely with suppliers, customers, logistics providers, banks, and government agencies to ensure timely, cost-effective, and legally compliant import/export activities.


Responsibilities


	Coordinate and manage all import and export activities including documentation, shipments, and customs clearance.
	Oversee transportation and warehousing strategies for international shipments
	Negotiate shipping rates and terms with freight forwarders, carriers, and other logistics partners.
	Process form MS and PAAR with ADBs or all international shipments
	Ensure proper filing and timely submission of all Exchange Control Documents (ECDs).
	Work closely with the procurement team, aftersales team, sales team, project team and warehouse teams to ensure timely deliveries and optimal stock levels.
	Develop and maintain relationships with suppliers, shipping companies, customs authorities and banks.
	Troubleshoot any shipping issues such as delays, damage, or non-compliance with customs procedures.
	Ensure compliance with customs laws, import/export regulations, and international trade agreements.
	Prepare and manage import/export documentation, such as bills of lading, invoices, certificates of origin, and packing lists, SONCAP certificate, PCR etc.
	Monitor and stay updated on changes in trade regulations, CET tariffs, HS Codes and customs requirements.
	Address and resolve any import/export-related disputes or problems efficiently
	Maintain accurate and organized records of all import/export activities and transactions.
	Prepare regular reports on shipping costs, timelines, inventory levels, and any issues encountered during the shipping process.
	Analyze and minimize transportation costs while optimizing service levels.
	Identify opportunities for process improvements that enhance efficiency and reduce costs.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in international business, Supply Chain Management, Logistics, or a related field. (Preferred)
	At least 3 years of experience in import/export management or international logistics.
	Strong understanding of international trade laws, customs regulations, and shipping documentation.
	Excellent organizational and multitasking skills.
	Strong communication and negotiation skills.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and logistics software or ERP.
	Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy.
	Data analytics.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Willingness to travel internationally as needed.
	Knowledge of Incoterms and international shipping practices.
	Work from the office at a minimum of 3 x in a week.
